description: The AWS::GameLift::Script resource creates a new script record for your Realtime Servers script. Realtime scripts are JavaScript that provide configuration settings and optional custom game logic for your game. The script is deployed when you create a Realtime Servers fleet to host your game sessions. Script logic is executed during an active game session.

Tag.description: A key-value pair to associate with a resource.

Key.description: The key name of the tag. You can specify a value that is 1 to 128 Unicode characters in length.
Key.markdownDescription:
The key name of the tag. You can specify a value that is 1 to 128 Unicode characters in length.

---

Required: Yes  
Type: String  
Minimum Length: 1  
Maximum Length: 128  
Update requires: No interruption

Value.description: The value for the tag. You can specify a value that is 0 to 256 Unicode characters in length.
Value.markdownDescription:
The value for the tag. You can specify a value that is 0 to 256 Unicode characters in length.

---

Required: Yes  
Type: String  
Maximum Length: 256  
Update requires: No interruption

Tag.markdownDescription:

S3Location.$comment: Contains object details present in the S3 Bucket

Bucket.description: An Amazon S3 bucket identifier. This is the name of the S3 bucket.
Bucket.markdownDescription:
An Amazon S3 bucket identifier. This is the name of the S3 bucket.

---

Required: Yes  
Type: String  
Minimum Length: 1  
Update requires: No interruption

Key.description: The name of the zip file that contains the script files.
Key.markdownDescription:
The name of the zip file that contains the script files.

---

Required: Yes  
Type: String  
Minimum Length: 1  
Update requires: No interruption

ObjectVersion.description: The version of the file, if object versioning is turned on for the bucket. Amazon GameLift uses this information when retrieving files from your S3 bucket. To retrieve a specific version of the file, provide an object version. To retrieve the latest version of the file, do not set this parameter.
ObjectVersion.markdownDescription:
The version of the file, if object versioning is turned on for the bucket. Amazon GameLift uses this information when retrieving files from your S3 bucket. To retrieve a specific version of the file, provide an object version. To retrieve the latest version of the file, do not set this parameter.

---

Required: No  
Type: String  
Minimum Length: 1  
Update requires: No interruption

RoleArn.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) for an IAM role that allows Amazon GameLift to access the S3 bucket.
RoleArn.markdownDescription:
The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) for an IAM role that allows Amazon GameLift to access the S3 bucket.

---

Required: Yes  
Type: String  
Minimum Length: 1  
Update requires: No interruption

S3Location.markdownDescription:
---

Required: No  
Update requires: No interruption

Name.description: A descriptive label that is associated with a script. Script names do not need to be unique.
Name.markdownDescription:
A descriptive label that is associated with a script. Script names do not need to be unique.

---

Required: No  
Type: String  
Minimum Length: 1  
Maximum Length: 1024  
Update requires: No interruption

StorageLocation.description: The location of the Amazon S3 bucket where a zipped file containing your Realtime scripts is stored. The storage location must specify the Amazon S3 bucket name, the zip file name (the "key"), and a role ARN that allows Amazon GameLift to access the Amazon S3 storage location. The S3 bucket must be in the same Region where you want to create a new script. By default, Amazon GameLift uploads the latest version of the zip file; if you have S3 object versioning turned on, you can use the ObjectVersion parameter to specify an earlier version.
StorageLocation.markdownDescription:
The location of the Amazon S3 bucket where a zipped file containing your Realtime scripts is stored. The storage location must specify the Amazon S3 bucket name, the zip file name (the "key"), and a role ARN that allows Amazon GameLift to access the Amazon S3 storage location. The S3 bucket must be in the same Region where you want to create a new script. By default, Amazon GameLift uploads the latest version of the zip file; if you have S3 object versioning turned on, you can use the ObjectVersion parameter to specify an earlier version.

---

Required: Yes  
Update requires: No interruption

Version.description: The version that is associated with a script. Version strings do not need to be unique.
Version.markdownDescription:
The version that is associated with a script. Version strings do not need to be unique.

CreationTime.markdownDescription:
A time stamp indicating when this data object was created. Format is a number expressed in Unix time as milliseconds (for example "1469498468.057").

Arn.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) that is assigned to a Amazon GameLift script resource and uniquely identifies it. ARNs are unique across all Regions. In a GameLift script ARN, the resource ID matches the Id value.
Arn.markdownDescription:
The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) that is assigned to a Amazon GameLift script resource and uniquely identifies it. ARNs are unique across all Regions. In a GameLift script ARN, the resource ID matches the Id value.

---

Required: No  
Type: String  
Pattern: ^arn:.*:script\/script-\S+  
Update requires: No interruption

Id.description: A unique identifier for the Realtime script
Id.markdownDescription:
A unique identifier for the Realtime script

---

Required: No  
Type: String  
Pattern: ^script-\S+  
Update requires: No interruption

SizeOnDisk.description: The file size of the uploaded Realtime script, expressed in bytes. When files are uploaded from an S3 location, this value remains at "0".
SizeOnDisk.markdownDescription:
The file size of the uploaded Realtime script, expressed in bytes. When files are uploaded from an S3 location, this value remains at "0".

Required: No  
Type: Integer
